intro: Stricklandia eucrosioides, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and have a hairy texture. Stricklandia eucrosioides thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
